title: ICE `expected statement` --test

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code `rustc --test file.rs` ```Rust #[test] mod FOO2 { fn r#final() { #[test] fn fooS(&'late u8) {} bar(-16); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.72.0-nightly (e6d4725c7 2023-06-05) binary: rustc commit-hash: e6d4725c76f3b526c74454bc51afdf6daf133506 commit-date: 2023-06-05 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.72.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.4 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

``` error: functions used as tests can not have any arguments --> treereduce.out:5:9 | 5 | fn fooS(&'late u8) {} | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'expected statement', compiler/rustc_expand/src/base.rs:174:18 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f7491b69ba1 -
